text: Río Clarillo National Park, or Río Clarillo National Reserve, is a protected place in the Santiago Metropolitan Region in central Chile. It is southeast of Santiago. It was made into a park in 1982 to protect the natural environment of central Chile and the living things that live there, including the Cordilleran cypress tree (Austrocedrus chilensis). ==References== Category:National parks in South America Category:Santiago Metropolitan Region
title: Río Clarillo National Park
